meanings.definition: Formally put an end to (a system, practice, or institution)
meanings.sent1: The government decided to abolish the outdated law.
meanings.sent2: The new policy will abolish the old rules.
meanings.sent3: It would be funny to abolish the tradition of wearing shoes on Tuesdays.
meanings.sent4: Her speech had the power to abolish any doubts in our minds.
meanings.sent5: The magician waved his wand and made the rabbit disappear, as if to abolish it from existence.

meanings.definition: Put an end to (a custom or practice)
meanings.sent1: The principal wanted to abolish the use of cell phones in school.
meanings.sent2: The community came together to abolish the harmful tradition.
meanings.sent3: It's time to abolish the habit of eating junk food every day.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could abolish any sadness in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The storm seemed to abolish all traces of the old town, washing it clean.
